answers.answer: I had a blighted ovum last year I should have been 13 weeks when I went to get my ultrasound but the baby stopped growing at 5 weeks. Nothing could be seen but two 2 saks. It took me another 2 weeks to actually miscarry then I had to go to the er for bleeding too much and had a d and c. Im hoping all will be well with you! At 5 weeks it could just be too early to see anything. The best of luck keep us posted. Its so hatd going through the worrying. Im in the same boat again wondering if this is a viable prenancy im only 6 weeks and have an appt on the 31st.

At 5 weeks it is really early to see much.  you should have a better idea at 6-7 weeks as how things are progressing.  Typically you will see a heartbeat around 7 weeks so don't be worried if you don't see that on your next ultrasound.  Hope everything goes perfectly for you!!

This happened in my 3rd pregnancy they seen everything except the baby. I wouldn't worry just yet. They doctor at the hospital wanted me to do a d&c but I refused. I went back a few weeks to an ob and found out that everything was OK and baby was just to small to see at the time. I had my first child at 35 weeks (during to preeclampsia)The first 2 pregnancies were miscarriages which I passed on my own.. Just be patient for now and see how it turns out I'm so glad. I didn't listen to the doctor at the hospital.

question: This is my second pregnancy.  I went to the doctor's yesterday and had my first ultrasound.  It dated me at 5 weeks and 2 days.  The doctor said that the report found a gestational sac but was unable to find a fetal pole or yolk sac.  He didn't seem too concerned and rescheduled me for another ultrasound for next Friday.  I am worried though. I have heard of blighted ovums. Has this happened to anyone?
title: First Ultrasound
